Event.Message: Unable to auto-configure library unit %1. The current setup of the library unit does not support automatic configuration. You will either have to modify the current setup of the library to adhere to automatic configuration guidelines (if possible) or manually configure the device.

Unable to configure library unit %1. The manual configuration information provided for this changer does not exist or conflicts with other devices on the system. This usually occurs when the same drive device is reported as belonging to more than one library unit or a drive is listed in the configuration that was not found on the system.
Library %1 failed to write a Free media label on media %2 because of an internal database error.
Library %1 failed to write a Free media label on media %2 because the media is not located in this library.
Library %1 failed to write a Free media label on media %2 because it is read only media.
Library %1 failed to write a Free media label on media %2 because the media is not located in a slot or drive.
Library %1 failed to write a Free media label on media %2 because an error occurred trying to move the media to a drive.
Library %1 failed to write a Free media label on media %2 because the media is write protected.
Library %1 failed to write a Free media label on media %2 because an I/O error occurred while writing the label.
Library %1 failed to write a Free media label on media %2 because RSM found a different piece of media in the library than was selected for the move to Free pool operation.
Library %1 failed to write a Free media label on media %2 because RSM does not support writing Free media labels on this type of media.

Library %1 failed to write a Free media label on media %2 because this media is located in a disabled drive. You must enable the drive before moving this media to the Free pool. If the media is in a standalone drive, eject the media (manually) and use a different drive.

Library %1 failed to write a Free media label on side 2 of media %2. RSM attempted to flip the media to access the second side but the media is in use by another process. RSM must have a Free media label on both sides of the media. Thus, this media is not valid Free media.
RSM cannot manage library %1. Another process is using the device.
RSM cannot manage library %1. The database is corrupt.
RSM cannot manage library %1. The library did not become ready in time.

RSM cannot manage library %1. It encountered an unspecified error. This can be caused by a number of problems including, but not limited to, database corruption, failure communicating with the library, or insufficient system resources.
RSM cannot manage library %1. The initial inventory of the library failed.
RSM mounted medium %1 in library %2 and there was an On-Medium Id mismatch.
Unable to acquire the computer name from the system.
Unable to access the required registry key: %1.
The library device: %1, is not ready.
Unable to determine if the drive: %1 needs to be cleaned.
The timeout period has expired for cleaning drive: %1.
Please remove the piece of media from the picker in library: %1.
Please remove the piece of media from the ieport in library: %1.
There is a drive missing in library: %1.
Unable to obtain the state of the drive: %1 in library: %2.
Unable to fetch database object: %1.
Unable to open drive: %1 in library: %2.
Unable to close drive: %1 in library: %2.
Unable to open library: %1.
Unable to close library: %1.
Unable to load media into drive: %1 in library: %2.
Unable to unload media from drive: %1 in library: %2.
Unable to lock drive: %1 in library: %2.
Unable to unlock drive: %1 in library: %2.
Unable to obtain operating characteristics from drive: %1 in library: %2.
The device: %1, is not ready.
Unable to obtain product data from drive: %1 in library: %2.
Unable to obtain extended operating characteristics from drive: %1 in library: %2.
Unable to obtain extended characteristics from media in drive: %1.
Unable to obtain statistics from %1.
Unable to obtain security information for the %1.
Unable to set security for the %1.
The door to library %2 has been open or unlocked for more than %1 seconds. Please close and lock the door to enable the library.
Unable to extend/retract the import/export element.
Unable to take inventory for %1 in %2.
Unable to retrieve inventory information from: %1.
Unable to obtain operating characteristics from library: %1.
Unable to move medium from drive %1 to slot %2 in library: %3. Please manually eject the media.
Unable to move medium from drive %1 in library: %3. Please manually remove the media.
The RSM Library Manager for %1 was started.
The RSM Library Manager was started with invalid arguments (%1).
A SCSI configuration error has been detected for library.
Unable to obtain characteristics from media in drive: %1 in library %2.
Unable to obtain the status of the import/export element.
Unable to control the front panel.
Unable to obtain characteristics from drive: %1.
Unable to attach to the Database, error = %1.
Unable to move medium from slot %1 to drive %2 in library: %3. Please check that the media is in the slot and that the drive is accessable.
Unable to move medium from IEPort %1 to slot %2 in library: %3. Please check that the media is in the IEPort and the slot is accessable.
Unable to move medium from slot %1 to IEPort %2 in library: %3. Please check that the media is in the slot is accessable and the IEPort is retracted.
Unable to move medium from the picker %1 to slot %2 in library: %3. Please check that the media is in the picker is accessable and the slot is accessable.
Unable to determine the SCSI configuration of the drives in library %1.
Unable to set the SCSI configuration of the drives in library %1.
Unable to configure the RSM to start the Library manager for library %1.
Unable to determine the number of drives in library %1 because the device is not ready.
Can not update the drive configuration of drive %1 in library %2 because another process has the drive open. Setting drive configuration from the Database.
Unable to determine the configuration of drive %1 in library %2 from the Database. Please close the drive and restart the Removable Storage Service.
Unable to obtain environmental data from drive : %1 in library: %2.
Disabled library: %1.
Enabled library: %1.
Disabled drive : %1 in library: %2.
Enabled drive : %1 in library: %2.
Reset the state on media %1.
Reset the state on drive %1.
The IE-Port in library %1 cannot be retracted.
The IE-Port in library %1 cannot be EXTENDED.
Library %1 is full and cannot accept any more media.
The physical media %x has been disabled.
Communication with the RSM database failed.
RSM is rebuilding its database file(s).
RSM database is not compatible with the Removable Storage Service binary.
RSM database is corrupt and cannot be rebuilt.
RSM database has determined that the disk is full (file=%1).
RSM database has received an i/o error from its storage device (file=%1)(code=%2).
RSM database has entered read only mode due to write errors.
RSM database has entered disabled mode to to i/o errors.
RSM database is recovering the index file.
RSM database is building the index file.
RSM database is reconstructing the data file.
Neither copy of the RSM database is consistent: Reconstructing using the main datafile.
RSM database IMPORT failed. The import files might not exist or there may not be enough disk space.
This RSM database has been relocated from server %1.
The RSM database has detected an internal inconsistency problem and has scheduled a rebuild (file=%1).
RSM could not register with service control manager.
RSM was stopped.
RSM was started.
RSM was called by the service controller with an unknown request.
Unable to set COM security level.
Unable to register the RSM service COM class objects. The error code is .
New media named "%1" was detected in library %2 having at least one unrecognized side and at least one recognized side. This media may be damaged.

The contents of at least one side of media "%1" have changed. This media may be damaged and has thus been disabled. To ignore this error and continue to use the media anyway, re-enable it using the Removable Storage Manager snap-in for the Microsoft Management Console (MMC).

Multisided media %1 could not be identified in library %2. RSM attempted to flip the media to identify the second side but could not because the media was in use by another process. This media has been forced into the Unrecognized pool and left in the disabled state. Perform a full inventory or eject the media and re-insert it into the library to fix this situation.

The transport (a.k.a. robot or picker) of library %1 contains a piece of media and is unable to place the media back to a slot. The media must be removed from the transport manually. If the library has a door, perform a door access and remove the media from the transport. Otherwise, if the library has no door, contact the library manufacturer's techinal support.

When RSM attempted to eject the media in drive %1 of library %2, the drive reported that it contained no media. Most likely, the drive rejected the media when RSM originally placed the media into it. This situation is usually caused when incompatible media or a cleaner cartridge is placed in a library with a door access or inject operation.
This RSM database has rejected an update using a stale record.
Automatic configuration for library %1 failed to configure %2. The driver for the device in this bay is not properly loaded.
RSM could not load media in drive %1 of library %2.
RSM could not open a handle to %1 (drive %2 of library %3).
RSM detected an internal error.
RSM has run out of memory.
RSM cannot identify media because a fatal error occurred while trying to load the Media Label Libraries.
RSM could not identify the media in drive %1 of library %2. An error was encountered while attempting to read data from the media.
RSM could not close its handle to %1 (drive %2 of library %3).
RSM could not verify the media in drive %1 of library %2 because the partition ID supplied was invalid.
RSM could not Verify the media in drive %1 of library %2 because the on-media-identifier did not match what was expected.
RSM could not Verify the media in drive %1 of library %2 because the on-media-identifier did not match what was expected.

Unable to manage the removable disk in drive %1. There are system files (paging files, RSM database files, and/or system/windows directories) on this disk which are needed for system operation. The drive will be disabled for RSM operations. This drive can be re-enabled via the Removable Storage Manager snap-in when there are no longer system files present.

Write Free Media Label operation on Media %1 was cancelled. Media was left in the UNPREPARED state and must be prepared via the Removable Storage Manager snap-in in order to be used by an application.
Failed to set the "%1" database attribute on the partition for side %2 of physical media "%3" during the %4 operation.
Failed to delete the "%1" database attribute from the partition for side %2 of physical media "%3" during the %4 operation.
Failed to perform a software load of the media "%2" in a drive of library "%1".
RSM mounted medium %1 in library %2 and verification of the On-Medium Id failed.
The device number of a(n) %1 cannot be determined. This device failed to configure. This event may be logged several times for the same device.

The RSM service is delaying its start for %1 seconds to assist with boot time performance . Modify the registry value "DelayStart" in the registry key "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\NTMS" to modify the start delay. This registry value denotes the number of milliseconds to wait before starting the service.
The RSM service has stopped because it cannot load the DLL "%1". Install or replace this DLL and restart the service.
Cannot find the procedure "%1" in DLL %2. Most likely, the version of this DLL is incompatible with the RSM service.
Cannot find the procedure "%1" in DLL %2. Most likely, the version of this DLL is incompatible with the RSM service.

This drive is located on %2.

This drive is located on %2.
Received a device interface ARRIVAL notification for device: %1
Received a device interface REMOVAL notification for device: %1

Denied a removal notification for device: %1
RSM is currently initializing or configuring new devices.
Received notification for a handle object. This particular notification was not relevant to RSM and was ignored.
Received Handle Volume Lock notification for a volume RSM manages. The volume was locked.
Received Handle Volume Lock notification for a volume RSM does not manage. No action was taken.
Received Handle Volume Unlock notification for a volume RSM manages. All handles were closed.
Received Handle Volume Unlock notification for a volume RSM does not manage. No action was taken.
Received Handle Volume Change notification for a volume RSM manages. RSM has updated its information for this volume.
Received Handle Volume Change notification for a volume RSM does not manage. No action was taken.
Error encountered in Media Label Library "%1". The registry values were not properly installed.
Error encountered when attempting to execute Media Label Library "%1". The DLL could not be loaded. Make sure the file exists and the path is correctly noted in the registry.
Did not match serial number "%1" provided by "%2 (%3)" among the list of drives.
Received Handle Query Remove notification. RSM approved the query remove request.
Received Handle Query Remove notification. RSM refused the request and prohibited this action.
Received Handle Query Remove Failure notification. RSM successfully acknowledged the event.
Received Handle Query Remove Failure notification. RSM failed to acknowledged the event.
Received Handle Query Remove Pending notification. RSM successfully acknowledged the event.
Received Handle Query Remove Pending notification. RSM failed to acknowledged the event.
Received Handle Query Remove Complete notification. RSM successfully acknowledged the event.
Received Handle Query Remove Complete notification. RSM failed to acknowledged the event.
RSM cannot manage library %1. Failed to communicate with device or obtain device setup information.
Drive "%1" in library "%2" needs cleaning.
The drive "%1" in library "%2" still needs cleaning after the last cleaning. Try a new cleaner next time.
RSM has run out of memory while trying to create the Writer.
Writer continuing with snapshot, but libraries haven't finished configuring. Possible loss of data in database.
RSM Writer couldn't add an entry in the registry. Database backup and/or restore may fail.
RSM Writer couldn't delete an entry in the registry. Database backup and/or restore may fail.
Unable to obtain the status of drive %1.
Unable to obtain the status of slot %1.
Unable to obtain the status of the transport element.
Unable to align slot %1 to transport element in library %2.
Unable to align drive %1 to transport element in library %2.
